<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 Compared to Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Revenues
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Brokerage Revenues
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Total
	brokerage revenues increased by $685.4 million, or 43.9%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Commission revenues increased by $626.2 million, or 47.9%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Principal transactions revenues increased by $59.2 million, or 23.3%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	86
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage88"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D77592D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The increase in brokerage revenues was primarily driven by the addition of GFI, the ongoing
	success of NGKF, our Real Estate Services segment and the continued strong double digit growth of our high margin FENICS fully electronic businesses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The increase in rates revenues of $66.9 million was primarily due to the acquisition of GFI.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our fully electronic credit revenues increased by $29.9 million as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, and our overall credit
	revenues increased by 21.0% to $273.3 million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. This increase was mainly due to our acquisition of GFI.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our FX revenues were up by 44.4% to $310.6 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. This increase was primarily driven by growth
	across our voice, hybrid, and fully electronic desks most notably in our e-brokered foreign exchange spot and derivative products. Our acquisitions of GFI and R.P. Martin also contributed to the increase.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our brokerage revenues from energy and commodities increased $142.5 million, or 255.4%, to $198.3 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015. This increase was primarily driven by our acquisition of GFI and organic growth.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our brokerage revenues from equities and other
	asset classes increased $67.2 million, or 55.7%, to $187.7 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. This increase was primarily driven by our acquisition of GFI.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Total Real Estate brokerage revenues increased by $265.0 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. This increase was primarily driven by the additions of Cornish&nbsp;&amp; Carey, ARA, and Excess Space. In addition, our Real Estate Services business generated strong double-digit organic growth.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Leasing and other services revenues increased by $121.0 million, or 28.9%, to $539.7 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as
	compared to the prior year period. This increase was primarily driven by strong commercial real estate market fundamentals.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Real estate
	capital markets revenues increased by $144.0 million, or 115.0%, to $269.2 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the prior year period. This increase was primarily driven by the acquisition of ARA.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Real Estate Management Services
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Real estate management services revenue increased $23.9 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. This increase was primarily driven
	by our acquisition of CFI.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Fees from Related Parties
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Fees from related parties decreased by $3.0 million, or 10.7%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Market Data and Software Solutions
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Market data and software solutions revenues increased by $85.6 million, or 903.5%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase was primarily driven by our acquisition of GFI.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Interest Income
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Interest income increased by $3.3 million, or 45.6%, to $10.6 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Other Revenues
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other revenues decreased by $7.3 million to $10.0 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. The decrease was primarily due to a settlement related to litigation received during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Expenses
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Compensation and Employee Benefits
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Compensation and employee benefits expense increased by $573.9 million, or 51.2%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The main driver of this increase was the increased level of brokerage revenues particularly related to the GFI acquisition and our Real Estate Services business as well as a reserve on employee loans.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Allocations of Net Income and Grant of Exchangeability to Limited Partnership Units and FPUs
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Allocations of net income and grant of exchangeability to limited partnership units and FPUs increased by $123.0 million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. This increase was primarily driven by an increase in charges related to grants of exchangeability to limited partnership units during the year as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	87
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage89"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D77592D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Occupancy and Equipment
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Occupancy and equipment expense increased $64.3 million to $211.7 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, as compared to the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. This increase was primarily driven by the acquisition of GFI in our Financial Services segment and the acquisitions of Cornish&nbsp;&amp; Carey and ARA in our Real Estate Services segment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Fees to Related Parties
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Fees to related parties increased by $5.9 million, or 48.7%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. Fees to related parties are allocations paid to Cantor for administrative and support services.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Professional
	and Consulting Fees
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Professional and consulting fees increased by $10.9 million, or 21.1%, to $62.8 million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase was primarily driven by the acquisition of GFI.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Communications
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Communications expense increased by $36.7 million, or 44.5%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. This increase was primarily driven by the acquisition of GFI. As a percentage of total revenues, communications remained relatively unchanged across the two periods.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Selling and Promotion
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Selling and promotion expense increased by $25.5 million, or 35.5%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase was primarily due to the acquisition of GFI.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Commissions and Floor Brokerage
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Commissions and floor brokerage expense increased by $15.7 million, or 81.4%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, primarily due to the acquisition of GFI.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Interest Expense
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Interest expense increased by $31.4 million, or 82.8%, to $69.4 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase was primarily driven by the interest expense associated with our 5.375% Senior Notes issued in December 2014, and the 8.375% Senior Notes acquired in the GFI acquisition in February 2015, partially offset by the
	maturity of the 8.75% Convertible Senior Notes on April&nbsp;15, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Other Expenses
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other expenses decreased by $12.8 million, or 8.5%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2014, primarily related to a decrease in litigation settlements, partially offset by an increase in commitments to make charitable contributions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Other Income (Losses), net
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Gain on Divestiture and Sale of Investments
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The gain on divestiture and sale of investments is related to the disposition of all the equity interests that made up the Trayport business,
	which was completed on December&nbsp;11, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Gains (Losses) on Equity Method Investments
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Gains (losses) on equity method investments increased by $10.5 million, to a gain of $1.9 million, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as
	compared to a loss of $8.6 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Gains (losses) on equity method investments represent our pro rata share of the net gains or losses on investments over which we have significant influence but do not
	control.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Other Income
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other income increased $73.7 million, or 149.2%, to $123.2 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. This increase was primarily driven by the recognition of the NASDAQ transaction earn out and the related mark-to-market movements and/or hedging associated with the NASDAQ and ICE shares as well as a $29.0 million gain with
	respect to appreciation on the 17.1 million shares of GFI common stock held by the Company prior to the successful completion of our tender offer.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	88
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage90"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D77592D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Provision for Income Taxes
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Provision for income taxes increased $119.8 million to $120.5 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. This increase was primarily driven by the increase in pretax earnings. Our consolidated effective tax rate can vary from period to period depending on, among other factors, the geographic and business mix of our earnings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Net Income (Loss) Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest in Subsidiaries
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net income (loss) attributable to noncontrolling interest in subsidiaries increased by $149.5 million, to $141.5 million, for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. This increase was due to the increase in allocation of net income to Cantor units in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. Also contributing to this increase was the
	allocation of GFI income to noncontrolling interests.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 Compared to Year Ended December&nbsp;31,
	2013
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Revenues
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Brokerage Revenues
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Total
	brokerage revenues increased by $49.7 million, or 3.3%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. Commission revenues increased by $105.7 million, or 8.8%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2014 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. Principal transactions revenues decreased by $56.0 million, or 18.1%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The increase in brokerage revenues was primarily driven by increases in leasing and other services, real estate capital markets,
	energy&nbsp;&amp; commodities and FX, partially offset by decreases in rates and credit products.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The decrease in rates revenues of $90.1
	million was primarily due to the sale of the eSpeed business in June 2013 and lower global interest rate activity during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our fully electronic credit revenues increased by $10.4 million as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013; however, our overall
	credit revenues declined by 7.6% to $225.9 million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. This decrease was mainly due to lower overall industry-wide inter-dealer activity in credit derivatives, investment-grade corporate bonds, and non-agency
	mortgage bonds.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our FX revenues were up by 1.4% to $215.2 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. This increase was primarily
	driven by growth across our voice, hybrid, and fully electronic desks most notably in our e-brokered foreign exchange spot and derivative products.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our energy&nbsp;&amp; commodities revenues increased $24.4 million, or 7.7%, to $55.8 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, due
	to organic growth and acquisitions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our brokerage revenues from equities and other asset classes increased $1.2 million, or 1.0%, to
	$120.5 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Total Real Estate brokerage revenues increased by $129.9 million for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. This increase was primarily driven by acquisitions as well as organic growth.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Leasing and other services
	revenues increased by $79.2 million, or 23.4%, to $417.8 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the prior year period. This increase was driven primarily by acquisitions and organic growth.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Real estate capital markets revenues increased by $50.7 million or 68.1%, to $125.2 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as
	compared to the prior year period. This increase was driven primarily by acquisitions and organic growth.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Real Estate Management
	Services
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Real estate management services revenue was relatively flat at $163.2 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Fees from Related Parties
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Fees from related parties decreased by $12.8 million, or 31.0%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013. The decrease was primarily due to decreased revenues related to ELX (as a result of the sale of the eSpeed business) and lower technology service fees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	89
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage91"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D77592D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Market Data and Software Solutions
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Market data and software solutions revenues decreased by $6.9 million, or 42.2%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.&nbsp;The decrease was primarily due to the sale of the eSpeed business and the Kleos Managed Services, Dedicated Network Access and Disaster Recovery business to NASDAQ in June 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Interest Income
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Interest
	income increased by $0.5 million, or 7.0%, to $7.3 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Other Revenues
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other
	revenues increased by $12.1 million to $17.2 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The increase was primarily due to a settlement related to litigation received during the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Expenses
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Compensation and Employee Benefits
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Compensation and employee benefits expense decreased by $134.5 million, or 10.7%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The main driver of this decrease was a charge of $160.5 million taken during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 related to the reduction of compensation-related partnership loans in connection with our Global
	Partnership Restructuring Program. The decrease was partially offset by increased compensation expense associated with higher brokerage revenues during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Allocations of Net Income and Grant of Exchangeability to Limited Partnership Units and FPUs
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Allocations of net income and grant of exchangeability to limited partnership units and FPUs decreased by $287.0 million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. This decrease was primarily driven by a $304.1 million charge taken in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 related to the redemption/exchange of limited partnership units
	in connection with our Global Partnership Restructuring Program.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Occupancy and Equipment
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Occupancy and equipment expense decreased $6.7 million to $147.4 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, as compared to the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. This decrease was primarily driven by lower depreciation and amortization costs as well as lower hardware maintenance costs following the sale of our eSpeed business in June 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Fees to Related Parties
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Fees to related parties increased by $2.7 million, or 28.5%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013. Fees to related parties are allocations paid to Cantor for administrative and support services.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Professional
	and Consulting Fees
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Professional and consulting fees were relatively flat at $51.8 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
	as compared to $51.4 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Communications
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Communications expense decreased by $9.5 million, or 10.4%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013. This decrease was primarily driven by our ongoing cost reduction program which rationalized and lowered the costs of certain market data terminals.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Selling and Promotion
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Selling and promotion expense decreased by $9.3 million, or 11.4%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013. The decrease was partially due to lower client entertainment expenses and partially due to our ongoing cost reduction program.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Commissions and Floor Brokerage
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Commissions and floor brokerage expense decreased by $3.2 million, or 14.1%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, primarily due to reduced clearing and transfer costs due to the sale of the eSpeed business to NASDAQ in June 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	90
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage92"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D77592D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Interest Expense
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Interest expense was relatively flat at $37.9 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to $38.3 million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013. The slight decrease was primarily related to our prepayment of collateralized debt during 2013 partially offset by the interest expense associated with our 5.375% Senior Notes issued in December 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Other Expenses
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other
	expenses increased by $46.7 million, or 44.8%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. This increase was primarily driven by charges taken during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 related
	to the cost of hiring additional brokers and litigation settlements, partially offset by charges taken during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 related to a commitment to make charitable contributions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Other Income (Losses), net
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Gain on Divestiture and Sale of Investments
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The gain on divestiture related to the NASDAQ Transaction was $723.1 million recorded in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Gains (Losses) on Equity Method Investments
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Gains (losses) on equity method investments decreased by $0.9 million, or 9.3%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. Gains (losses) on equity method investments represent our pro rata share of the net gains (losses) on investments over which we have significant influence but do not control.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Other Income
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other
	income increased $10.0 million, or 25.2%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the year earlier period. This increase was due to the $52.8 million recognized on the earn-out related to the NASDAQ Transaction and the associated
	mark-to-market movements and/or hedging in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, we recognized $39.5 million on the earn-out related to the NASDAQ Transaction. In both periods we received 992,247 shares
	of NASDAQ stock. The increased income was driven by the year-over-year increase in the share price.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Provision for Income Taxes
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Provision for income taxes decreased $91.5 million to $0.7 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the year
	earlier period. This decrease was primarily driven by a decrease in taxable income in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to the year earlier period, as the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 included the gain on divestiture related to
	sale of eSpeed. Our consolidated effective tax rate can vary from period to period depending on, among other factors, the geographic and business mix of our earnings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Net Income Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest in Subsidiaries
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net income attributable to noncontrolling interest in subsidiaries decreased by $110.8 million, to a loss of 8.0&nbsp;million, for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to income of $102.8 million the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. This decrease was due to lower income during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as the year earlier period included the gain on
	divestiture related to the sale of eSpeed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Business Segment Financial Results
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The business segments are determined based on the products and services provided and reflect the manner in which financial information is
	evaluated by management. We evaluate the performance and review the results of the segments based on each segment&#146;s &#147;Income (loss) from operations before income taxes.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Certain financial information for our segments is presented below. The amounts shown below for the Financial Services and Real Estate Services
	segments reflect the amounts that are used by management to allocate resources and assess performance, which is based on each segment&#146;s &#147;Income (loss) from operations before income taxes.&#148; In addition to the two business segments, the
	tables below include a &#147;Corporate Items&#148; category. Corporate revenues include fees from related parties and interest income as well as gains that are not considered part of the Company&#146;s ordinary, ongoing business. Corporate expenses
	include non-cash compensation expenses (such as the grant of exchangeability to limited partnership units; redemption/exchange of partnership units, issuance of restricted shares and allocations of net income to founding/working partner units and
	limited partnership units) as well as unallocated expenses such as certain professional and consulting fees, executive compensation and interest expense, which are managed separately at the corporate level.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	91
</P>

	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Financial Services segment income (loss) from operations before income taxes includes $68.0 million related to the earn-out portion of the NASDAQ Transaction consideration
	and the associated mark-to-market movements and/or hedging. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Real Estate Services segment income (loss) from operations before income taxes excludes $2.1 million related to the collection of receivables
	and associated expenses that were recognized at fair value as part of acquisition accounting.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2014 (in thousands):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="92%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="59%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	1
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Financial Services segment income (loss) from operations before income taxes includes $52.8 million related to the earn-out portion of the NASDAQ Transaction consideration
	and the associated mark-to-market movements and/or hedging. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Real Estate Services segment income (loss) from operations before income taxes excludes $9.6 million related to the collection of receivables
	and associated expenses that were recognized at fair value as part of acquisition accounting.
</TD>

	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	1
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, the Financial Services segment revenues include $39.5 million related to the earn-out portion of the NASDAQ Transaction consideration and related hedging transactions. For the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, the Real Estate Services segment income (loss) from operations before income taxes excludes $10.6 million related to the collection of receivables and associated expenses that were recognized at fair value as part
	of acquisition accounting. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, Corporate Items income (loss) from operations before income taxes includes a $723.1 million gain on divestiture related to the sale of eSpeed and approximately $465 million in
	compensation expense related to the Global Partnership Restructuring Program.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Segment Results for the Year Ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 Compared to Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Revenues
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Revenues for Financial Services increased approximately $498.8 million, or 47.8%, to $1,543.2 million for year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 from $1,044.3 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase
	in revenues for our Financial Services segment was primarily due to an increase in brokerage revenues in energy and commodities, foreign exchange, rates and credit, as well as an increase in equities and other asset classes, and an increase in
	market data and software solutions primarily driven by the acquisitions of GFI and R.P. Martin, as well as by organic growth from our desks in foreign exchange, energy and commodities.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Revenues for Real Estate Services increased approximately $289.7 million, or 40.9%, to $998.5 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 from $708.8 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase
	in revenues for our Real Estate Services segment was primarily due to the acquisitions of Cornish&nbsp;&amp; Carey and ARA, and an increase in broker productivity along with favorable industry trends in sales and leasing for the U.S. commercial real
	estate market.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Total expenses for Financial Services increased approximately $453.5 million, or 52.5%, to $1,317.4 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 from $863.8 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The
	increase in expenses for our Financial Services Segment was primarily due to the acquisition of GFI and R.P. Martin.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	increase in expenses for our Real Estate Services segment was primarily due to increased compensation associated with acquisitions.

	2014. The increase in expenses for Corporate Items was primarily due to increases in charges related to grants of exchangeability to limited partnership units during the year as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as well as a reserve
	on employee loans and a commitment to make charitable contributions.

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Revenues for Financial Services decreased approximately $80.4 million, or 7.1%, to $1,044.3 million for year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 from $1,124.8 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The decrease in
	revenues for our Financial Services segment was primarily due to a decline in brokerage revenues in rates (primarily due to the sale of eSpeed in June 2013) and credit, partially offset by an increase in equities and other asset classes and FX.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	in revenues for our Real Estate Services segment was primarily due to the acquisition of Cornish&nbsp;&amp; Carey and a significant increase in broker productivity along with favorable industry trends in sales and leasing for the U.S. commercial
	real estate market.
</TD>

	decrease in expenses for our Financial Services Segment was primarily due to lower compensation related costs, due to lower revenues and our continued cost reduction program.

	December&nbsp;31, 2013. The increase in income (loss) from operations before income taxes for our Real Estate Services segment was due to increased revenues, as described above, partially offset by an increase in expenses, as also described above.

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D77592D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_15"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	QUARTERLY RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following table sets forth our unaudited quarterly results of operations for the indicated periods (in thousands). Results of any period
	are not necessarily indicative of results for a full year and may, in certain periods, be affected by seasonal fluctuations in our business. Certain reclassifications have been made to prior period amounts to conform to the current period&#146;s
	presentation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</TD>

<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	LIQUIDITY AND CAPITAL RESOURCES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Balance Sheet
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our
	balance sheet and business model are not capital intensive. Our assets consist largely of cash, marketable securities, collateralized and uncollateralized short-dated receivables and less liquid assets needed to support our business. Longer-term
	capital (equity and notes payable) is held to support the less liquid assets and potential capital intensive opportunities. Total assets at December&nbsp;31, 2015 were $4.0 billion, an increase of 45.1&nbsp;% as compared to December&nbsp;31, 2014.
	The increase in total assets was driven primarily by increases in marketable securities, goodwill and other intangible assets. These increases were primarily related to the acquisitions of GFI, ARA, CFI and Excess Space. We maintain a significant
	portion of our assets in cash and marketable securities, with our liquidity (which we define as cash and cash equivalents, marketable securities and securities owned) at December&nbsp;31, 2015 of $1,026.1 million. See &#147;Liquidity Analysis&#148;
	below for a further discussion of our liquidity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On June&nbsp;23, 2015, the Audit Committee of the Company authorized management to enter
	into a revolving credit facility with Cantor of up to $150 million in aggregate principal amount pursuant to which Cantor or BGC would be entitled to borrow funds from each other from time to time. The outstanding balances would bear interest at the
	higher of the borrower&#146;s or the lender&#146;s short term borrowing rate then in effect plus 1%. There were no borrowings outstanding under the facility as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	96
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage99"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D77592D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As part of our cash management process, we may enter into tri-party reverse repurchase agreements
	and other short term investments, some of which may be with Cantor. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had no reverse repurchase agreements outstanding with Cantor.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Additionally, in August 2013, the Audit Committee authorized us to invest up to $350 million in an asset-backed commercial paper program for
	which certain Cantor entities serve as placement agent and referral agent. The program issues short-term notes to money market investors and is expected to be used from time to time as a liquidity management vehicle. The notes are backed by assets
	of highly rated banks. We are entitled to invest in the program so long as the program meets investment policy guidelines, including relating to ratings. Cantor will earn a spread between the rate it receives from the short-term note issuer and the
	rate it pays to us on any investments in this program. This spread will be no greater than the spread earned by Cantor for placement of any other commercial paper note in the program. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had no investments in the
	program.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Funding
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our funding base consists of longer-term capital (equity and notes payable), shorter-term liabilities and accruals that are a natural outgrowth
	of specific assets and/or our business model, such as matched fails and accrued compensation. We have limited need for short-term unsecured funding in our regulated entities for their brokerage business. Contingent liquidity needs are largely
	limited to potential cash collateral that may be needed to meet clearing bank, clearinghouse, and exchange margins and/or to fund fails. Capital expenditures tend to be cash neutral and approximately in line with depreciation. Current cash balances
	significantly exceed our unsecured letters of credit and our unsecured bank borrowings. We believe that cash in and available to our largest regulated entities, inclusive of financing provided by clearing banks, is adequate for potential cash
	demands of normal operations such as margin or fail financing. We expect our operating activities going forward to generate adequate cash flows to fund normal operations, including any dividends issued pursuant to our dividend policy. However, we
	believe that there are a significant number of capital intensive opportunities for us to maximize our growth and strategic position, including, among other things, acquisitions, strategic alliances and joint ventures potentially involving all types
	and combinations of equity, debt and acquisition alternatives. As a result, we may need to raise additional funds to:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	increase the regulatory net capital necessary to support operations;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	support continued growth in our business;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	effect acquisitions;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	develop new or enhanced services and markets; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	respond to competitive pressures.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Acquisitions and financial reporting obligations related
	thereto may impact our ability to access capital markets on a timely basis and may necessitate greater short-term borrowings in the interim. This may impact our credit rating or the interest rates on our debt. We may need to access short-term
	capital sources to meet business needs from time to time, including, but not limited to, conducting operations, hiring or retaining brokers, financing acquisitions, and providing liquidity, including in situations where we may not be able to access
	the capital markets in a timely manner when desired by us. Accordingly, we cannot guarantee that we will be able to obtain additional financing when needed on terms that are acceptable to us, if at all.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On June&nbsp;28, 2013, upon completion of the sale of eSpeed (see &#147;NASDAQ Transaction&#148; herein), we received cash consideration of
	$750 million, subject to adjustment for certain pre-paid amounts and accrued costs and expenses, plus an earn-out of up to 14,883,705 shares of NASDAQ common stock to be paid ratably in each of the fifteen years following the closing.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On February&nbsp;26, 2015, we successfully completed our tender offer to acquire shares of common stock, par value $0.01 per share, of GFI for
	$6.10 per share in cash and accepted for purchase 54.3&nbsp;million shares tendered to us pursuant to the offer. The tendered shares, together with the 17.1&nbsp;million shares already owned by us, represented approximately 56% of the
	then-outstanding shares of GFI. We issued payment for the tendered shares on March&nbsp;4, 2015 in the aggregate amount of $331.1 million. On April&nbsp;28, 2015, we purchased from GFI approximately 43.0&nbsp;million new shares at that date&#146;s
	closing price of $5.81 per share, for an aggregate purchase price of $250 million. The purchase price was paid to GFI in the form of a note due on June&nbsp;19, 2018 that bore an interest rate of LIBOR plus 200 basis points. The new shares and the
	note eliminate in consolidation. Following the issuance of the new shares, we owned approximately 67% of GFI&#146;s outstanding common stock, which gave us control over the timing and process for the completion of a back-end merger (the
	&#147;Back-End Mergers&#148;) pursuant to the tender offer agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On January&nbsp;12, 2016, we completed our acquisition (the
	&#147;JPI Merger&#148;) of Jersey Partners, Inc. (&#147;JPI&#148;). The JPI Merger occurred pursuant to a merger agreement (the &#147;Merger Agreement&#148;), dated as of December&nbsp;22, 2015. Shortly following the completion of the JPI Merger, a
	subsidiary of BGC merged with and into GFI pursuant to a short-form merger under Delaware law, with GFI continuing as the surviving entity (the &#147;GFI Merger&#148;). The Back-End Mergers allowed BGC to acquire the remaining approximately 33
	percent of the outstanding shares of GFI common stock that BGC did not already own.&nbsp;Following the closing of the Back-End Mergers, BGC and its affiliates now own 100 percent of the outstanding shares of GFI&#146;s common stock. See Note
	4&#151;&#147;Acquisitions&#148; to the consolidated financial statements in Part II, Item&nbsp;8 of this Annual Report on Form 10-K for further information about the GFI transaction.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	97
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage100"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D77592D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In total, approximately 23.5&nbsp;million shares of BGC Class&nbsp;A Common Stock and $111.3
	million in cash were issued or paid with respect to the closing of the Back-End Mergers, inclusive of adjustments.&nbsp;The total purchase consideration for all shares of GFI purchased by BGC was approximately $750 million, net of the $250.0 million
	note previously issued to GFI by BGC, which is eliminated in consolidation.&nbsp;This figure excludes the $29.0 million gain recorded in the first quarter of 2015 with respect to the appreciation of the 17.1&nbsp;million shares of GFI held by BGC
	prior to the successful completion of the tender offer. The excess of total consideration over the fair value of the total net assets acquired, of approximately $453.8 million, has been recorded to goodwill and was allocated to our Financial
	Services segment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, our liquidity, which we define as cash and cash equivalents, marketable securities and
	securities owned, was approximately $1.0 billion. In December, we sold the Trayport business to ICE in exchange for approximately 2.5&nbsp;million ICE common shares issued with respect to the $650 million purchase price, which was adjusted at
	closing.&nbsp;The proceeds from the Trayport sale contributed to our more than $1 billion of balance sheet liquidity as of the end of the year.&nbsp;In addition to our strong current liquidity position, we expect to receive over $760 million in
	additional NASDAQ stock over time (stock value based on the February&nbsp;25, 2016 closing price), which is not reflected on our balance sheet. We anticipate having $1.7 billion available to us to drive substantial returns for our investors.&nbsp;We
	expect to use our considerable financial resources to repay debt, profitably hire, make accretive acquisitions, pay dividends, and/or repurchase shares and units of BGC, all while maintaining or improving our investment grade rating.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Notes Payable, Collateralized Borrowings and Short-Term Borrowings
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	8.75% Convertible Notes
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On April&nbsp;1, 2010, BGC Holdings issued an aggregate of $150.0 million principal amount of the 8.75% Convertible Notes to Cantor. We used
	the proceeds of the 8.75% Convertible Notes to repay at maturity $150.0 million aggregate principal amount of Senior Notes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On
	April&nbsp;13, 2015, the 8.75% Convertible Notes, due April&nbsp;15, 2015, were fully converted into approximately 24.0&nbsp;million shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock. On June&nbsp;15, 2015, we filed a resale registration statement on Form S-3
	pursuant to which 24,042,599 shares of our Class&nbsp;A common stock may be sold from time to time by Cantor or by certain of its pledgees, donees, distributees, counterparties, transferees or other successors of interest of the shares, including
	banks or other financial institutions which may enter into stock pledge, stock loan or other financing transactions with Cantor or its affiliates, as well as by their respective pledgees, donees, distributees, counterparties, transferees or other
	successors in interest.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	4.50% Convertible Notes
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On July&nbsp;29, 2011, we issued an aggregate of $160.0 million principal amount of 4.50% Convertible Notes. In connection with the offering of
	the 4.50% Convertible Notes, we entered into an Indenture, dated as of July&nbsp;29, 2011, with U.S. Bank National Association, as trustee. The 4.50% Convertible Notes were offered and sold solely to qualified institutional buyers pursuant to Rule
	144A under the Securities Act.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The 4.50% Convertible Notes are our general senior unsecured obligations. The 4.50% Convertible Notes pay
	interest semi-annually at a rate of 4.50%&nbsp;per annum and were priced at par. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the 4.50% Convertible Notes were convertible, at the holder&#146;s option, at a conversion rate of 101.6260 shares of Class&nbsp;A common
	stock per $1,000 principal amount of notes, subject to adjustment in certain circumstances. Upon conversion, we will pay or deliver, as the case may be, cash, shares of our Class&nbsp;A common stock, or a combination thereof at our election. As of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, the 4.50% Convertible Notes were convertible into approximately 16.3&nbsp;million shares of our Class&nbsp;A common stock. The 4.50% Convertible Notes will mature on July&nbsp;15, 2016, unless earlier repurchased, exchanged
	or converted. The carrying value of the 4.50% Convertible Notes was approximately $157.3 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In
	connection with the offering of the 4.50% Convertible Notes, we entered into capped call transactions, which are expected to reduce the potential dilution of our Class&nbsp;A common stock upon any conversion of 4.50% Convertible Notes in the event
	that the market value per share of our Class&nbsp;A common stock, as measured under the terms of the capped call transactions, is greater than the strike price of the capped call transactions, which was $10.78 as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, subject
	to adjustment in certain circumstances. The capped call transactions had a cap price equal to $13.48 per share as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The net proceeds from this offering were approximately $144.2 million after deducting the initial purchasers&#146; discounts and commissions,
	estimated offering expenses and the cost of the capped call transactions. We used the net proceeds from the offering for general corporate purposes, including financing acquisitions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	98
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage101"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D77592D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	8.125% Senior Notes
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On June&nbsp;26, 2012, we issued an aggregate of $112.5 million principal amount of 8.125% Senior Notes due 2042. The 8.125% Senior Notes are
	our senior unsecured obligations. The 8.125% Senior Notes may be redeemed for cash, in whole or in part, on or after June&nbsp;26, 2017, at our option, at any time and from time to time, until maturity at a redemption price equal to 100% of the
	principal amount to be redeemed, plus accrued but unpaid interest on the principal amount being redeemed to, but not including, the redemption date. The 8.125% Senior Notes are listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol &#147;BGCA.&#148;
	We used the proceeds to repay short-term borrowings under our unsecured revolving credit facility and for general corporate purposes, including acquisitions. The initial carrying value of the 8.125% Senior Notes was $108.7 million, net of debt
	issuance costs of $3.8 million. Cantor Fitzgerald&nbsp;&amp; Co. (&#147;CF&amp;Co&#148;), an affiliate of us, served as one of the underwriters in this transaction and was paid an underwriting fee of approximately $0.2 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	5.375% Senior Notes
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On
	December&nbsp;9, 2014, the Company issued an aggregate of $300.0 million principal amount of 5.375% Senior Notes due 2019 (&#147;the 5.375% Senior Notes&#148;). The 5.375% Senior Notes are general senior unsecured obligations of the Company. These
	Senior Notes bear interest at a rate of 5.375%&nbsp;per year, payable in cash on June&nbsp;9 and December&nbsp;9 of each year, commencing June&nbsp;9, 2015. The interest rate payable on the notes will be subject to adjustments from time to time
	based on the debt rating assigned by specified rating agencies to the notes, as set forth in the Indenture. The 5.375% Senior Notes will mature on December&nbsp;9, 2019. The Company may redeem some or all of the notes at any time or from time to
	time for cash at certain &#147;make-whole&#148; redemption prices (as set forth in the Indenture). If a &#147;Change of Control Triggering Event&#148; (as defined in the Indenture) occurs, holders may require the Company to purchase all or a portion
	of their notes for cash at a price equal to 101% of the principal amount of the notes to be purchased plus any accrued and unpaid interest to, but excluding, the purchase date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The initial carrying value of the 5.375% Senior Notes was $295.1 million, net of the discount and debt issuance costs of $4.9 million. The
	issuance costs are amortized as interest cost, and the carrying value of the 5.375% Senior Notes will accrete up to the face amount over the term of the notes. The Company recorded interest expense related to the 5.375% Senior Notes of $17.1 million
	and $1.0 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	8.375% Senior Notes
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As part of the GFI acquisition, the Company acquired $240.0 million in aggregate principal amount of 8.375% Senior Notes (the &#147;8.375%
	Senior Notes&#148;) due July 2018. The fair value of these notes as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 was $263.7 million. Interest on these notes is payable, semi-annually in arrears on the 19th of January and July. Due to the cumulative effect of
	downgrades to the credit rating of GFI&#146;s 8.375% Senior Notes, the 8.375% Senior Notes were previously subjected to 200 basis points penalty interest. On April&nbsp;28, 2015, a subsidiary of the Company purchased from GFI approximately
	43.0&nbsp;million newly issued shares of GFI&#146;s common stock. This increased BGC&#146;s ownership to approximately 67% of GFI&#146;s outstanding common stock and gave us the ability to control the timing and process with respect to a full
	merger, which as discussed in Note 25&#151;&#147;Subsequent Events&#148; to our consolidated financial statements, was completed on January&nbsp;12, 2016. Also on July&nbsp;10, 2015, we guaranteed the obligations of GFI under these 8.375% Senior
	Notes. These actions resulted in upgrades of the credit ratings of GFI&#146;s 8.375% Senior Notes by Moody&#146;s Investors Service, Fitch Ratings Inc. and Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor&#146;s, which reduced the penalty interest to 25 basis points
	effective July&nbsp;19, 2015. On November&nbsp;4, 2015, GFI, BGC and the Trustee entered into the First Supplemental Indenture supplementing the Indenture and incorporating BGC&#146;s guarantee of the Notes (the &#147;First Supplemental
	Indenture&#148;). On January&nbsp;13, 2016, Moody&#146;s Investors Service further upgraded the credit rating on GFI&#146;s 8.375% Senior Notes, eliminating the penalty interest.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On January&nbsp;12, 2016, BGC Partners, Inc. entered into a second supplemental indenture, dated as of January&nbsp;12, 2016 (the &#147;Second
	Supplemental Indenture&#148;), among GFI Group Inc. (&#147;GFI&#148;), BGC and The Bank of New York Mellon Trust Company, N.A., as trustee (the &#147;Trustee&#148;), supplementing the indenture, dated as of July&nbsp;19, 2011, as supplemented by the
	First Supplemental Indenture thereto, dated as of November&nbsp;4, 2015 (the &#147;Indenture&#148;), among GFI, BGC and the Trustee, which governs the 8.375% Senior Notes due 2018 (the &#147;Notes&#148;), issued by GFI and fully and unconditionally
	guaranteed by BGC.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Second Supplemental Indenture modifies the reporting covenant in the Indenture to provide that, for so long as BGC
	(or another publicly reporting company controlling GFI) guarantees the Notes, the reports that BGC (or such other publicly reporting company controlling GFI) files with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#147;SEC&#148;) will be furnished
	to the Trustee in lieu of any GFI SEC reports.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The amendments contained in the Second Supplemental Indenture became operative on
	January&nbsp;12, 2016, upon GFI&#146;s payment of the consent fee described therein. The final amount of the consent fee was approximately $8.00 per $1,000 principal amount. As a result, effective January&nbsp;15, 2016, GFI ceased filing annual,
	quarterly and other reports with the SEC.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company recorded interest expense related to the 8.375% Senior Notes of $19.2 million for
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	99
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage102"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D77592D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Collateralized Borrowings
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On various dates beginning in 2009 and most recently in December 2012, the Company entered into secured loan arrangements under which it
	pledged certain fixed assets as security for loans. The secured loan arrangements had fixed rates between 2.62% and 8.09%&nbsp;per annum and were repayable in consecutive monthly installments with the final payments due in December 2016. During the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company prepaid $1.5 million related to the secured loan arrangements; therefore, these secured loan arrangements were not outstanding as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 or 2014. The Company recorded interest expense
	related to these secured loan arrangements of $4 thousand and $1.6 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, and 2013 respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On March&nbsp;13, 2015, the Company entered into a new secured loan arrangement of $28.2 million under which it pledged certain fixed assets
	as security for a loan. This arrangement incurs interest at a fixed rate of 3.70% and matures on March&nbsp;13, 2019. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company had $23.0 million outstanding related to this secured loan arrangement, which includes
	$0.2 million of deferred financing costs. The value of the fixed assets pledged as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 was $11.4 million. The Company recorded interest expense related to this secured loan arrangement of $0.8 million year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Credit Agreements
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As part of the GFI acquisition, we assumed a credit agreement as amended (the &#147;GFI Credit Agreement&#148;) with Bank of America, N.A. and
	certain other lenders, which provided for maximum revolving loans of up to $75.0 million. We repaid the amount outstanding on October&nbsp;2, 2015, prior to the sale of our Trayport division. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we recorded
	interest expense related to the GFI Credit Agreement of $1.9 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On October&nbsp;1, 2015, we entered into a previously authorized
	$150.0 million revolving credit facility (the &#147;Facility&#148;) with Cantor and borrowed $100.0 million under such facility (the &#147;Cantor Loan&#148;). The Cantor Loan bears interest at the rate of LIBOR plus 3.25% and may be adjusted based
	on Cantor&#146;s short-term borrowing rate then in effect plus 1%. The Facility has a maturity date of August&nbsp;10, 2017. The Company recorded interest expense related to the Cantor Loan of $0.8 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
	The Cantor Loan was repaid by December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On December&nbsp;24, 2015, we entered into a committed unsecured credit agreement
	with Bank of America, N.A. The credit agreement provides for maximum revolving loans of $25 million through March&nbsp;24, 2016. The interest rate on this facility is LIBOR plus 200 basis points. There were no borrowings outstanding under the
	facility as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On February&nbsp;25, 2016, we entered into a committed unsecured credit agreement with Bank of
	America, N.A., as administrative agent, and a syndicate of lenders. Several of our domestic non-regulated subsidiaries are parties to the credit agreement as guarantors. The credit agreement provides for maximum revolving loans of $150 million, with
	the option to increase the aggregate loans to $200 million. The maturity date of the facility is February&nbsp;25, 2018. Borrowings under this facility bear interest at either LIBOR or a defined base rate plus an additional margin which ranges from
	50 basis points to 250 basis points depending on our debt rating as determined by S&amp;P and Fitch and whether such loan is a LIBOR loan or a base rate loan. Contemporaneously with the closing of this credit agreement, the $25 million unsecured
	credit agreement entered into on December&nbsp;24, 2015 with Bank of America, N.A. as lender was terminated. As of February&nbsp;29, 2016, there were no borrowings outstanding under either this $150 million facility or the terminated $25 million
	facility.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We may raise additional funds from time to time through equity or debt financing, including public and private sales of debt
	securities, to finance our business, operations and possible acquisitions.
</P>
